meanings.definition: A circle that passes through all the vertices of a polygon.
meanings.sent1: The circumcircles of the shape intersect at specific points.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician drew the circumcircles to find the center of the polygon.
meanings.sent3: The circumcircles of the polygon had a race to see which one was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the circumcircles of a polygon, reaching every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the circumcircles in geometry fascinated the students.

meanings.definition: To draw a circle that passes through all the vertices of a polygon.
meanings.sent1: She carefully circumcircles the polygon on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to circumcircles the shape to create a unique design.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to help by circumcircling the polygon with its tail.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to circumcircles around her, enveloping her in warmth.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they watched their teacher circumcircles the polygon on the board.
